questions.question: What does the central limit theorem state?

answers.a: if the sample size increases sampling distribution must approach normal distribution
answers.b: if the sample size decreases then the sample distribution must approach normal distribution
answers.c: if the sample size increases then the sampling distribution much approach an exponential distribution
answers.d: if the sample size decreases then the sampling distribution much approach an exponential distribution

explanations.a: Explanation: The central limit theorem states that if the sample size increases sampling distribution must approach normal distribution. Generally a sample size more than 30 us considered as large enough.
explanations.b: Explanation: The central limit theorem states that if the sample size increases sampling distribution must approach normal distribution. Generally a sample size more than 30 us considered as large enough.
explanations.c: Explanation: The central limit theorem states that if the sample size increases sampling distribution must approach normal distribution. Generally a sample size more than 30 us considered as large enough.
explanations.d: Explanation: The central limit theorem states that if the sample size increases sampling distribution must approach normal distribution. Generally a sample size more than 30 us considered as large enough.

questions.question: The Central Limit Theorem says that the sampling distribution of the sample mean is approximately normal if?

answers.c: the standard error of the sampling distribution is small.

explanations.a: The Central Limit Theorem says that the sampling distribution of the sample mean is approximately normal if the sample size is large.
explanations.b: The Central Limit Theorem says that the sampling distribution of the sample mean is approximately normal if the sample size is large.
explanations.c: The Central Limit Theorem says that the sampling distribution of the sample mean is approximately normal if the sample size is large.
explanations.d: The Central Limit Theorem says that the sampling distribution of the sample mean is approximately normal if the sample size is large.

questions.question: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is?

answers.a: equal to the population mean divided by the square root of the sample size
answers.b: close to the population mean if the sample size is large
answers.c: exactly equal to the population mean
answers.d: equal to the population mean divided by the sample size

explanations.a: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean.
explanations.b: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean.
explanations.c: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean.
explanations.d: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean.

questions.question: The Central Limit Theorem says that the standard deviation of the sampling distribution of the sample means is ?

answers.a: equal to the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size
answers.b: close to the population standard deviation if the sample size is large
answers.c: exactly equal to the standard deviation
answers.d: equal to the population standard deviation divided by the sample size

explanations.a: standard deviation is equal to the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size.
explanations.b: standard deviation is equal to the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size.
explanations.c: standard deviation is equal to the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size.
explanations.d: standard deviation is equal to the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size.

questions.question: Samples of size 25 are selected from a population with mean 40 and standard deviation 7.5. The mean of the sampling distribution of sample means is?

explanations.a: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean, therefore mean=40.
explanations.b: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean, therefore mean=40.
explanations.c: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean, therefore mean=40.
explanations.d: The Central Limit Theorem says that the mean of the sampling distribution of the sample means is exactly equal to the population mean, therefore mean=40.
